Title - "Idealcoder's Blog"

1@211.body: Am I right in saying that when a site updates only the pages that have changed are sent - so the network traffic is minimal from regular updates?

1@212.body:
Images/videos are easy to crawl - you could just look in content.json for files with .jpg/.png/.mp4. The problem is going to always be how to decentralize the crawling - either locally you peer every single website, or some remote server generates compressed data files ( e.g. thumbnails of images) which are downloaded. 

BTW, discovering sites is easy - just look on namecoin blockchain; it's downloading them all that is hard. 

Then again - google search doesn't run off one single computer anyway ;(.
Very detailed thanks. Only deals with how to split up the indexing job - an important part, but there also needs to be some kind of decentralized search on all the data.

3@2.body:
Oracle - I am pretty sure the ZeroNet blog, uses markdown, so you can add an image using that. 

![alt text](https://github.com/adam-p/markdown-here/raw/master/src/common/images/icon48.png "Logo Title Text 1")

You could store the image in your site folder and then link to it.
